ARABIC: خُشَّعًا أَبْصَٰرُهُمْ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلْأَجْدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمْ جَرَادٌ مُّنتَشِرٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: they will emerge from their graves with downcast eyes, like swarming locusts,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They will come out of the graves with downcast eyes like an expanding swarm of locusts.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: with down-cast eyes they shall go forth from their graves, as though they were scattered locusts.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: they will come out of their graves, their eyes cast down, hastening towards their Summoner as locusts rushing about.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They will come out from the graves with eyes lowered, as if they were spread locusts.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They will come forth, with humbled eyes from (their) graves as if they were locusts spread abroad,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Their eyes cast down, going forth from their graves as if they were scattered locusts,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: abasing their eyes, they shall come forth from the tombs as if they were scattered grasshoppers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: With downcast eyes, they come forth from the graves as they were locusts spread abroad,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: with downcast eyes they shall come out of their graves, as if they were locusts milling about
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: With looks downcast they will come forth, from the tombs, as though they were locusts scattered abroad.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: they will emerge from the graves as if they were scattered locusts with a humbled look [in their eyes],
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They will come forth,- their eyes humbled - from (their) graves, (torpid) like locusts scattered abroad,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They will come forth, with humbled eyes from (their) graves as if they were locusts spread abroad,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: their eyes will be humbled as they come out from their graves as if they were scattered locusts,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Their eyes humiliated, they will emerge from the graves, as if they were swarming locusts.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Their eyes humbled, they will emerge from the graves as if they were locusts spreading,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [54:7] with their downcast (khāshi‘an: a variant reading has khushsha‘an), humiliated, looks (absāruhum is a circumstantial qualifier referring to the subject of the verb [yakhrujūna, ‘they will emerge’]) they, that is, mankind, will emerge from the graves as though they were scattered locusts, not knowing where to go, out of fear and perplexity (this sentence [ka’annahum jarādun muntashirun] is a circumstantial qualifier referring to the subject of [the verb] yakhrujūna, ‘they will emerge’, and so is His saying [muhti‘īna]),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (With downcast eyes) humbled, (they come forth from the graves) upon the first blow of the Trumpet (as they were locusts spread abroad) He says: they fall on each other like locusts,
